Title: Cylinder Seal with Deity, Worshipper and Inscription
Description: The depicted scene features a standing deity in a long robe with foot on foot rest. Facing the standing deity is a second standing figure in a long, tufted robe. Behind this second figure is a third- a standing goddess with horned crown and raised hands. The field between the standing deity with footrest and the worshipper includes an inverted crescent. The scene also incorporates a cuneiform inscription in three registers.
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore, [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Mesopotamian
